title: Understanding Severe Mental Illness (SMI)
text: Severe mental illness (SMI) is a term used to describe mental disorders that significantly interfere with a person's ability to function in daily life. These conditions often require comprehensive treatment and support.

title: Characteristics of SMI
text: SMI often involves conditions like schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and severe depression. These conditions can affect a person's thoughts, emotions, and behaviors, making it challenging to manage daily activities without support.

title: Role of Case Managers in SMI
text: Case managers play a crucial role in supporting individuals with SMI. They help coordinate care, provide resources, and ensure that the person receives the necessary support to live independently.
